headline.print_headline: Taiwan's Wei Family to Buy Cable TV Operator CNS for $2.4 Billion: Source
headline.main: Taiwan's Wei Family to Buy Cable TV Operator CNS for $2.4 Billion: Source

lead_paragraph: Taiwan's Wei family has agreed to buy China Network Systems (CNS), the nation's biggest cable TV operator, for about $2.4 billion (1.44 billion pounds) including debt from private equity firm MBK Partners, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Sunday.
